content.question: A disk initially at rest is acted upon by a constant net torque of <math alttext="tau" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>τ</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. The disk spins for a period of <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> seconds and rotates an angular distance of <math alttext="delta theta" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mi>θ</mi></mstyle></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. The same disk is brought to rest. The disk is now acted upon by a constant net torque of <math alttext="2 tau" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>τ</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. The disk spins for the same period of <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> seconds. What is the new angular distance the disk rotates?
